examples: Interpreters are also skilled at keeping aplomb in the face of chaos.
words.defineEn: a type of manner that is composed and confident, often when one is facing a difficult situation
words.defineVi: một loại phong cách điềm tĩnh và tự tin, thường là khi một người đối mặt với một tình huống khó khăn

words.defineEn: an insensitive and uneducated person who lacks culture and manners
words.defineVi: một người vô cảm và vô học, thiếu văn hóa và cách cư xử

examples: To his, and many other astronomers’, chagrin, the name stuck.
To NASCAR fans' chagrin, it's somewhat true.
It has been winning Formula One races in recent years to the chagrin of longtime leader Ferrari.
Much to the chagrin of other Polish thinkers, who felt it disrespectful to his country of birth.
words.defineEn: a state of annoyance or embarrassment due to failing, getting humiliated, or disappointed
words.defineVi: một trạng thái khó chịu hoặc bối rối do thất bại, bị sỉ nhục hoặc thất vọng

examples: Pat Hatfield-Nalls: Pete is a bit of a curmudgeon but a lovable one.
My grandfather, who was just a real curmudgeon, came up to me and said, "Who was that?"
words.defineEn: a bad-tempered person who is easily annoyed and angered, usually old in age
words.defineVi: một người nóng tính, dễ bực bội và tức giận, thường là người già

examples: It just seems to set them on edge that these women in positions of power who are deeply knowledgeable and intensely competent are able and have, in the Russian eyes, the effrontery to stand up to them and just hold their ground.
words.defineEn: a way of behaving that is shamelessly rude and bold
words.defineVi: một cách cư xử thô lỗ và táo bạo

words.defineEn: a prideful and unfriendly manner of behaving that showcases one's belief of being better than others
words.defineVi: một cách cư xử kiêu hãnh và không thân thiện thể hiện niềm tin của một người là tốt hơn những người khác

words.defineEn: a way of behaving that is relaxed, as if one has no problems or concerns
words.defineVi: một cách cư xử thoải mái, như thể một người không có vấn đề hoặc mối quan tâm

examples: Badgers are found all over the world.
So what do the badgers do?
Now we fill it with Badgers.
Badgers like to eat worms, but they also will eat just about anything else.
And also like badgers, they’ll eat just about anything.
words.defineEn: to repeatedly and annoyingly ask someone something, particularly as a way of persuasion
words.defineVi: liên tục và khó chịu hỏi ai đó một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cách thuyết phục

words.defineEn: to force a person into doing something by threatening or frightening them
words.defineVi: để buộc một người làm điều gì đó bằng cách đe dọa hoặc làm họ sợ hãi

examples: America didn’t get hip to this until the mid 19th century, when publishers started realizing they could gamify the industry by following suit and by also publishing books to the taste of audiences, and not necessarily by what the intelligentsia deigned to disburse to the rabble.
words.defineEn: to do something in a reluctant and condescending manner
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó một cách miễn cưỡng và trịch thượng

examples: I think I accidentally cut off part of it while I was beginning and I accidentally lacerated the top of it.
words.defineEn: to emotionally or mentally make someone suffer from a lot of pain
words.defineVi: để tình cảm hoặc tinh thần làm cho ai đó chịu đựng rất nhiều đau đớn

examples: And they may be more amenable to a deeper discount as the end of the month approaches.
And it may lead to a politics that is more amenable to our measures that will help relieve inequality.
And then this relatively obscure national security adviser named Carter Page, who is much more amenable to Moscow than some of the hawks.
Come up with the top three things you would change about your job and see if they're amenable.
So he did somersaults trying to come out with some sort of a plan that would be amenable to Republicans, and he got absolutely nowhere.
words.defineEn: (of people) open and willing to let suggestions influence them
words.defineVi: (của mọi người) cởi mở và sẵn sàng để đề xuất ảnh hưởng đến họ

words.defineEn: displaying approval or praise
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự chấp thuận hoặc khen ngợi

examples: For the arduous trek before them, she knew they required the sturdy guidance of one who had walked many paths.
The trip was an arduous climb that took all day.
So, Descartes began the arduous task of examining his beliefs one by one.
Some estimates say only 2% of wild Aquilaria trees are adequately infected to produce agarwood naturally, meaning the hunt to find natural agarwood is extremely arduous.
And they couldn't get consumers to actually link their accounts because it was too arduous, too difficult.
words.defineEn: requiring so much effort, mostly physical, that will cause exhaustion
words.defineVi: đòi hỏi rất nhiều nỗ lực, chủ yếu là thể chất, sẽ gây ra kiệt sức

examples: Ruling caliphs became avid players themselves.
I'm an avid user of Google Docs.
I'm an avid supplement fan
According to his Facebook page, he was an avid lover of planes, bikes and motorcycles.
An avid golfer, he resolved to build his own nine-hole course.
words.defineEn: extremely enthusiastic and interested in something one does
words.defineVi: cực kỳ nhiệt tình và quan tâm đến một cái gì đó một người làm

examples: Investors must not become complacent that the economy is in smooth water, as there are still a number of factors that could lead to another recession.

In the world of politics, it's important to remember that hares may pull dead lions by the beard, as even the most influential leaders can fall from grace if they become too complacent or lose the support of the people.
As the team celebrated their early lead, the coach reminded them that he that sings on Friday shall weep on Sunday, warning them not to get too complacent.
These men have never been complacent.
So we can't be complacent about our state of preparedness.
words.defineEn: pleased and satisfied with oneself or a situation, feeling that there is no need for improvement
words.defineVi: hài lòng và hài lòng với bản thân hoặc một tình huống, cảm thấy rằng không cần phải cải thiện

examples: And if you've ever read a nutrition label or seen this thing called the television, you're probably pretty conversant in the way we classify fats.
words.defineEn: knowledgeable or experienced with something
words.defineVi: kiến thức hoặc kinh nghiệm với một cái gì đó

examples: And this is the kind of craven act that we are witnessing right now, for the sake of positioning oneself for a presidential election four years from now, is shameful.
words.defineEn: not having even the smallest amount of courage
words.defineVi: không có chút can đảm nào

words.defineEn: (particularly of a man) handsome, stylish and full of confidence
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là của một người đàn ông) đẹp trai, phong độ và đầy tự tin

examples: His calls for his friends and family echoed from derelict walls.
It sat derelict for years but now they have people here and they're working on the property and they're kind of trying to bring it back to LIFE.
words.defineEn: neglectful toward obligations and duties
words.defineVi: lơ là với nghĩa vụ và bổn phận

words.defineEn: making one feel worried or anxious about something
words.defineVi: làm cho một người cảm thấy lo lắng hoặc lo lắng về một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: causing or displaying great sadness or distress
words.defineVi: gây ra hoặc hiển thị nỗi buồn lớn hoặc đau khổ

examples: And having this kind of fractious coalition, we had to sort out a lot of things.
With so many competing nation with different interests and fractious ideas and territorial governance, how are we going to tackle those issues if we can't even get our own house in order?
words.defineEn: easily getting annoyed, angry, or upset
words.defineVi: dễ dàng trở nên khó chịu, tức giận hoặc khó chịu

examples: And so this setup was impervious to civilian intervention.
I'm impervious to your piddly little balls!
They're impervious to electromagnetic interference.
And we shouldn't assume that our political institutions are impervious to the opinions of the public.
And for their inspection equipment, EDAC needed to have ultra stable computers that are basically impervious to dust.
words.defineEn: resistant to being affected or damaged by something
words.defineVi: khả năng chống bị ảnh hưởng hoặc bị hư hại bởi một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: referring to something that is false or someone that has lied
words.defineVi: đề cập đến một cái gì đó là sai hoặc ai đó đã nói dối

examples: It's also an obtuse angle.
For the next few minutes, the blob is sleeping in its obtuse triangle form.
This is obtuse, 110 degrees.
The angle is more Obtuse which indicates that the bullet is traveling much slower.
The obtuse triangle, which has an angle greater than 90 degrees, wakes up as usual and keeps growing.
words.defineEn: slow or reluctant to understand things or respond emotionally to something
words.defineVi: chậm hoặc miễn cưỡng để hiểu mọi thứ hoặc phản ứng cảm xúc với một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: having too much pride or confidence in oneself
words.defineVi: có quá nhiều niềm tự hào hoặc tự tin vào bản thân

words.defineEn: demanding immediate obedience, particularly in a way that sounds unfriendly or rude
words.defineVi: yêu cầu sự vâng lời ngay lập tức, đặc biệt là theo cách nghe có vẻ không thân thiện hoặc thô lỗ

words.defineEn: having the ability to quickly judge or understand someone or something in an accurate way
words.defineVi: có khả năng nhanh chóng đánh giá hoặc hiểu một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó một cách chính xác

words.defineEn: considered to be of small importance or value
words.defineVi: được coi là có tầm quan trọng hoặc giá trị nhỏ

examples: It's for a kind of prosaic reason.

But it’s also important to remember that regular soldiers often had more prosaic reasons for going off to fight, as you will eventually learn when you are forced to read The Red Badge of Courage, Goldfield tells the story of one Alabamian who enlisted only after his girlfriend mailed him a dress and told him he should start wearing if he wasn’t willing to go fight.
words.defineEn: plain and ordinary; lacking excitement and imagination
words.defineVi: đơn giản và bình thường; thiếu hứng thú và trí tưởng tượng

words.defineEn: paying a lot of attention to the correctness of behavior or to detail
words.defineVi: chú ý nhiều đến tính đúng đắn của hành vi hoặc chi tiết

words.defineEn: (of a person) showing great strength, in a way that makes others be afraid of one
words.defineVi: (của một người) thể hiện sức mạnh to lớn, theo cách khiến người khác sợ hãi

words.defineEn: making rude and humorous remarks about sex
words.defineVi: đưa ra những nhận xét thô lỗ và hài hước về tình dục

words.defineEn: easily angered or annoyed
words.defineVi: dễ dàng tức giận hoặc khó chịu

words.defineEn: staying calm and displaying little or no interest or emotions
words.defineVi: giữ bình tĩnh và thể hiện ít hoặc không quan tâm hoặc cảm xúc

words.defineEn: treating others as if one is superior to them
words.defineVi: đối xử với người khác như thể một người vượt trội hơn họ
